content.question: Close examination of the maze-like galleries of the temple complex at Chavín de Huántar has led scholars to theorize that they might have functioned as

choices.label: a defensive system intended to disorient enemy attackers
a symbolic representation of the soul's passage into the afterlife
an acoustic system for projecting sounds to the plaza outside the temple
a passageway for accessing subterranean burial sites and shrines of rulers

content.answer: an acoustic system for projecting sounds to the plaza outside the temple

topic.text: 5.4: Theories and Interpretations of Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
